paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene variant V30M, its clinical significance, penetrance data, and the effects of pharmacological treatments on amyloid deposition in a transgenic mouse model.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Hereditary ATTR V30M amyloidosis is a life-threatening progressive sensory-motor and autonomic peripheral neuropathy.
Hereditary ATTR V30M amyloidosis is a life-threatening progressive sensory-motor and autonomic peripheral neuropathy.
Hereditary ATTR V30M amyloidosis is a life-threatening progressive sensory-motor and autonomic peripheral neuropathy.
Even though there are more than a 100 mutations causing ATTR amyloidoses, the first discovered and by far the most common is ATTR V30M.

functional_data.summary: The study demonstrated that pharmacological stimulation of phagocytosis enhances amyloid plaque clearance in a transgenic mouse model of ATTR V30M.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence for pathogenicity based on clinical presentation and family segregation
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the variability in penetrance and age of onset among carriers of the TTR V30M variant.
key_quotes: There is considerable variability in the age of onset and penetrance of hereditary ATTR V30M in different countries.
Even though there are more than a 100 mutations causing ATTR amyloidoses, the first discovered and by far the most common is ATTR V30M.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text, focusing on the TTR gene.
